CAT: A small furry pet that meows and purrs
DOG: A loyal pet that barks and wags its tail
BIRD: An animal with wings and feathers that can fly
FISH: A sea animal we can also eat as food
BEAR: A large, strong animal with thick fur
LION: A large wild cat called the king of the jungle
TIGER: A large wild cat with orange fur and black stripes
FROG: A small green animal that can jump and lives near water
DUCK: A bird that swims and says quack
COW: A farm animal that gives us milk
PIG: A pink farm animal that says oink
HEN: A female chicken that lays eggs
BEE: A flying insect that makes honey
ANT: A tiny insect that lives in groups and works hard
OWL: A bird that is awake at night and says hoo
FOX: A clever wild animal with a bushy tail
BAT: A flying animal that comes out at night
RAT: A small rodent with a long tail
DEER: A gentle forest animal with antlers
WOLF: A wild animal related to dogs that howls
GOAT: A farm animal with horns that eats grass
SHEEP: A fluffy farm animal that gives us wool
MOUSE: A tiny rodent with big ears
SNAKE: A long animal without legs that slithers
WHALE: The biggest animal in the ocean
EAGLE: A large bird of prey with sharp eyes
SHARK: A large fish with sharp teeth
CRAB: A sea creature with claws that walks sideways
SNAIL: A slow creature that carries its shell
EYE: The part of your body you see with
EAR: The part of your body you hear with
NOSE: The part of your face you smell with
HAND: The part at the end of your arm with fingers
FOOT: The part at the end of your leg you walk on
HEAD: The top part of your body with your brain
ARM: The long part of your body attached to your shoulder
LEG: The long part of your body you walk with
HAIR: The thin strands that grow on your head
FACE: The front of your head with eyes and nose
APPLE: A round red or green fruit that grows on trees
CAKE: A sweet dessert often eaten at birthdays
MILK: A white drink that comes from cows
BREAD: A food made from flour that we use for sandwiches
EGG: An oval food that comes from chickens
RICE: Small white grains we cook and eat
CORN: A yellow vegetable that grows on a cob
BEAN: A small seed vegetable that comes in pods
SOUP: A warm liquid food you eat with a spoon
SALT: White crystals that make food taste better
CANDY: A sweet treat made with sugar
JUICE: A drink made from squeezed fruit
WATER: A clear liquid we need to drink to live
SUN: The bright star that gives us light and warmth
MOON: The round object we see in the night sky
STAR: Tiny lights we see twinkling at night
SKY: The blue space above us during the day
SNOW: White frozen flakes that fall in winter
WIND: Moving air you can feel but not see
TREE: A tall plant with a trunk and leaves
LEAF: The flat green part of a plant or tree
FLOWER: The colorful part of a plant that smells nice
GRASS: Short green plants that cover the ground
ROCK: A hard piece of earth or stone
SAND: Tiny bits of rock found at beaches
SEA: A large body of salty water
LAKE: A body of water surrounded by land
HILL: A raised area of land smaller than a mountain
CLOUD: White fluffy shapes in the sky made of water
FIRE: Hot flames that give light and heat
ICE: Frozen water that is very cold
BALL: A round toy you can throw and catch
BOOK: Pages with words and pictures bound together
DOOR: What you open to go in or out of a room
TABLE: Furniture with a flat top for putting things on
CLOCK: A device that tells you what time it is
PHONE: A device for talking to people far away
KEY: A small metal thing that opens locks
BOX: A container with sides and a lid
BOWL: A round deep dish for food
SPOON: A tool for eating soup and cereal
FORK: A tool with points for picking up food
KNIFE: A tool with a blade for cutting
PEN: A tool for writing with ink
GAME: An activity you play for fun
CARD: A paper with a message or for playing games
RUN: To move fast on your feet
JUMP: To push yourself up off the ground
WALK: To move on your feet at a normal pace
SWIM: To move through water using your body
PLAY: To have fun doing an activity
READ: To look at words and understand them
SING: To make music with your voice
DRAW: To make pictures with a pen or pencil
EAT: To put food in your mouth and swallow
SLEEP: To rest with your eyes closed
HELP: To do something for someone who needs it
GIVE: To hand something to another person
TAKE: To get something with your hand
FIND: To discover something you were looking for
LOOK: To use your eyes to see
HEAR: To notice sounds with your ears
NEW: Recently made or not used before
OLD: Having existed for a long time
GOOD: Of high quality or morally right
BAD: Of poor quality or morally wrong
ROUND: Shaped like a circle or ball
RED: The color of fire trucks and strawberries
BLUE: The color of the sky and ocean
GREEN: The color of grass and leaves
YELLOW: The color of the sun and bananas
ORANGE: The color between red and yellow
BROWN: The color of chocolate and wood
FRIEND: Someone you like and enjoy being with
SHOP: A place where you buy things
FARM: A place where animals and crops are raised
BEACH: A sandy area by the sea
CITY: A large town with many buildings
ROAD: A path for cars and people to travel on
DAY: The time when the sun is up
NIGHT: The time when the sun is down
YES: A word to agree or say something is true
NO: A word to disagree or refuse
LOVE: A strong feeling of caring for someone
WORK: Something you do that takes effort
IDEA: A thought or plan in your mind
WORD: A unit of language that has meaning
NAME: What you are called
LIFE: The time when you are alive
WORLD: The Earth and everything on it
